text: November unemployment rates ranged from 3.1% in NE and VT to 10.2% in NJ.
14 states and DC have lost 25% or more of their leisure and hospitality jobs since January.
From Q3 2019 to Q3 2020, house price increases ranged from 4.0% in ND to 14.4% in ID.
Compared with a year prior, Q2 2020 GDP declines ranged from 4.6% in UT to 13.9% in HI.
Average private weekly earnings among states range from $792 in MS to $1,250 in MA.
Unemployment rates remain above their Great Recession peaks in AK, HI, ND, and NJ.
Tennessee and 19 other states hit a decade high in annual house price growth in Q3 2020.
Only 12 states saw a year-over-year increase in retail employment in November.
SC’s Q2 2020 GDP from accommodation and food services was half of what it was in Q2 2019.
State and local public jobs in New Hampshire are 11% lower than in November 2019.
Washington’s annual house price growth has exceeded the US average each quarter since 2014.
New York’s real GDP from manufacturing dropped to a 15-year low in Q2 2020.
